references.paper_title: Graph-based topology reasoning for driving scenes
references.reason: This paper is the most directly related work to the current paper, as it focuses on the same problem of lane topology reasoning in driving scenes and serves as a baseline for comparison.

references.paper_title: Topology preserving local road network estimation from single onboard camera image
references.reason: This paper proposes a method for generating lane topology matrices based on the geometric distances between lanes and the similarity of lane query, which inspired some aspects of the current paper's methodology.
The DETR object detection framework, introduced in this paper, is used as a component of the proposed TopoLogic pipeline, making it a crucial foundational paper.

references.paper_title: nuScenes: A multimodal dataset for autonomous driving
references.reason: The nuScenes dataset, introduced in this paper, is one of the datasets used for evaluating the performance of the TopoLogic pipeline and is essential for benchmarking in autonomous driving.

references.paper_title: OpenLane-V2: A topology reasoning benchmark for unified 3d hd mapping
references.reason: The OpenLane-V2 benchmark, introduced in this paper, is used extensively for evaluating and comparing the performance of different lane topology reasoning methods, and it serves as the primary benchmark dataset for the proposed method.
